intro: Polystemma canisferum, commonly known as the hairy polystemma, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Polystichaceae and is characterized by its rhizomatous growth habit. The plant features pinnately compound leaves with a dense covering of short, soft hairs. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Polystemma canisferum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
